rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C199644

self.title: CDISC SEND Genetic Toxicology In vivo Method Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the technique or procedure used to determine the result of a genetic toxicology In vivo test.
name: Genetic Toxicology In vivo Method
preferredTerm: CDISC SEND Genetic Toxicology In vivo Method Terminology

terms.definition: A technique for counting, examining or sorting microscopic particles in which the particles are placed in a fluid (with or without light-sensitive dye) and passed through a beam of light.
Microscopy of specimens stained with fluorescent dye or naturally fluorescent materials.
A fluorescent microscopy technique that is performed by a device and imaging software.
A fluorescent microscopy technique that is performed by visual inspection.

A form of microscopy that involves passing light transmitted through or reflected from the subject through a series of lenses to be detected directly by the eye, imaged on a photographic plate, or captured digitally.
The application of microscope magnification to the study of materials that cannot be properly seen by the unaided eye. (NCI)
